column4: Does anyone in here know why Windows would need the Windows Install CD to be in the CD drive to boot, though it doesn't actually boot the CD?
I need this error fixed big time
> youre not getting some kind of error message with the demand for the disc?
because regardless it will ask me to boot from CD (even thought it's clearly on the hard drive.
<< you resolve your cd problem yet?
>> cool! i am glad to hear that
best is a relative, meaningless term. the repos are full of cool things, just search, try and keep or remove as you see fit.
Well I figured that, but really I don;t know where to look. I know for GIMP there is GIMPShop, but I don't know necessarily where to get it and all. I was hoping for a website, like download.com
what kind of app - something you've downloaded? or from the repos?
do this instead. open a term and type ...  sudo apt-get install vnc
do this instead. open a term and type ...  sudo apt-get install vls
do this instead. open a term and type ...  sudo apt-get install vlc
the file to install I don;t understand
type "sudo apt-get install vlc" in a term. this will download the file and install it for you, as vlc is available in the repos
what about repos confuses you?
Nevermind I read something and it jsut clicked I get it lol ... Are there a lot of repositories?
uhmmm i believe that there are others that can be added manually but i am not positive. if there are, they are something used at your own risk
are you doing this in X?
do you have Synaptic open ?
go to Settings on the menu, you'll find the repo option under there
I did nice list of new apps
